enWisdom: Showing [one’s] affluence is from [the ways of showing] gratitude

Wisdom: أَكْثِرِ النَّظَرَ إِلَى مَنْ فُضِّلْتَ عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أَبْوَابِ الشُّكْرِ
enWisdom: Look frequently at those over whom you have been given superiority, for verily this is one of the gates [and means] of gratitude
The best gratitude for blessings is favoring others with them

Wisdom: إِذَا قَصُرَتْ يَدُكَ عَنِ الْمُكَافَاةِ فَأَطِلْ لِسَانَكَ بِالشُّكْرِ
enWisdom: When your hand is short and unable to recompense [the one who does good to you] then lengthen your speech with gratitude
The gratitude of one who is under you is through generous bestowal
Showing gratitude to your Lord is [done] through prolonged praise
The gratitude of one who is above you is through true friendship and loyalty
The gratitude of a believer is manifested in his action

Wisdom: شَكَرَ الْإِحْسَانَ مَنْ أَثْنَى عَلَى مُسْدِيهِ وَذَكَرَ بِالْجَمِيلِ مُولِيَهُ
enWisdom: He who praises his benefactor and mentions him with goodness [and appreciation] has shown gratitude for [his] kindness

Wisdom: لَنْ يَسْتَطِيعَ أَحَدٌ أَنْ يَشْكُرَ النِّعَمَ بِمِثْلِ الْإِنْعَامِ بِهَا
enWisdom: One cannot show gratitude for blessings in a better way than using them to benefit others
